title: Labour urges ministers to close ‘glaring loopholes’ in knife crime plans
description: The party wants to see ninja swords included in a ban of dangerous weapons and tech bosses face criminal sanctions for allowing online knife sales.

title: Why does Keir Starmer want to scrap popular Labour policies?
description: The latest reported U-turn, on the pledge to spend £28bn a year on green investment, is the biggest yet. The policy was one of Labour’s most bold and genuinely interesting pledges. It was also popular: a poll last year found that 52 per cent of voters backed it, while only 30 per cent disagreed. But with boldness comes risk, and so it had to go.

title: Destroy the spa pool of Captain Tom Moore’s daughter in new Duke Smoochem video game mod

title: Keir Starmer promises patient health records in one place under Labour
description: Sir Keir Starmer has pledged to introduce “patient passports” to provide a digital record of every patient’s health information if Labour wins the next election. The Times Health Commission proposed developing a single digital health record which patients could take with them wherever they are treated within the NHS.

title: 'Keir Starmer is out of touch with the public if he wants to scrap a cap on bankers' bonuses'
description: In his regular column for the Daily Record, Stephen Flynn says the moral compass of too many MPs is firmly back stuck behind the walls of Westminster

title: Address to Vigil for Palestinian Health Workers Killed in Gaza

title: Mum of ninja sword victim Ronan Kanda demands terrifying weapons are finally banned
description: Pooja Kanda, whose son Ronan was murdered in June 2022, wants a clampdown on websites selling blades online. Labour believes tech firm bosses should be held responsible

title: King Charles cancer diagnosis: Rishi Sunak wishes monarch 'full and speedy recovery'
description: Rishi Sunak has wished the King a speedy recovery after Buckingham Palace announced he was diagnosed with a form of cancer.

title: King Charles diagnosed with cancer and has started treatment, Buckingham Palace says

title: The Green Party Overtakes The Tories As The Second Most Popular For Voters Under 30
description: A YouGov poll revealed that for voters aged 18 to 24, the Green Party is nine per cent more popular than the Conservative Party and 12 per cent ahead of the Liberal Democrats.

title: Sir Keir Starmer branded ‘pie snatcher’ after warning football fans to watch what they eat
description: SIR Keir Starmer was branded a ‘pie snatcher’ after warning football fans to watch what they eat to help the beautiful game go green. The Labour chief says there are “little things”

title: The longest hour: Piers Morgan’s excruciating ‘interview’ with Rishi Sunak
description: Prime minister joined UK Sun God for an exchange of awkward blokey bants, unbased claims and bonfire of vanities

title: King Charles III diagnosed with cancer, Buckingham Palace says
description: King Charles has been diagnosed with a form of cancer, says Buckingham Palace. It is not prostate cancer, but was discovered during his recent treatment for an enlarged prostate. The type of cancer has not been revealed, but the palace said the King began "regular treatments" on Monday.

title: Politics latest: King and PM to continue weekly audiences - as 'concerned' Biden reveals plans to call

title: King diagnosed with cancer, Palace announces
description: The King has been diagnosed with a form of cancer, Buckingham Palace has announced. The Palace confirmed the disease, which is not prostate cancer, was discovered while the King was being treated in hospital for an enlarged prostate.

title: King Charles has cancer: Everything we know so far
description: The monarch faces more treatment after the health issue was discovered while he was being treated for an enlarged prostate in hospital

title: The moment BBC broke news of King Charles’ cancer diagnosis
description: The Palace has not specified which cancer King Charles has been diagnosed with but confirmed it was not prostate cancer, while messages of support for the 75-year-old have been pouring in from leading figures including Sir Keir Starmer and Gary Lineker.

title: Are British Muslims losing faith in Starmer’s Labour?
description: A new poll suggests that over a quarter fewer British Muslims would back Sir Keir Starmer’s Labour party. We have been visiting some constituencies where independents are now standing against Labour incumbents.

title: Sunak wishes King ‘speedy recovery’ as well wishes pour in from politicians
description: Well wishes for the King have poured in from across the political spectrum after Buckingham Palace announced he was diagnosed with a form of cancer. Charles has begun a schedule of regular treatments and has been advised to postpone his public-facing duties.

title: Sadiq Khan promises there won’t be any changes to Ulez scheme
